Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't publish symbols because name collision on nuget.org" (#7848) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
I can no longer publish symbols on nuget.smbsrc.net because someone published (and later delisted) a package with the same name.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Download MSI nupkg from https://dev.azure.com/heaths/public/_build/results?buildId=210&view=artifacts&type=publishedArtifacts
2. Regenerate my key (it had expired), copy it, and try to publish to wither www.nuget.org (either package or symbol package) or nuget.smbsrc.net (symbol package).

### Expected behavior
I can publish the symbol package.

### Actual behavior
I get an HTTP 403 error. Seems someone published https://www.nuget.org/packages/msi, which is the name of my package for powershellgallery.com. I've been publishing symbols this way for a while, but no longer can because of a name collision on nuget.org. There was never a need to publish the package to nuget.org (it's a PowerShell module). Seems authentication and authorization shouldn't necessarily be tied together. Is there some other way?

I can't seem to log into www.symbolsource.org anymore either. I can't remember account information (it's been a long time since I logged in), but http://www.symbolsource.org/Public/Account/SendPasswordMail says it requires a secure connection, but www.symbolsource.org doesn't respond via HTTPS.

### Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here.

Link to MSI package on PowerShell Gallery: https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/MSI

### Azure Search Service

Changes:
- Use managed identity for KeyVault access: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2972

Release: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=579684

- [ ] DEV
- [ ] INT
- [ ] PROD

### CDNRedirect service

Changes:
- Use KeyVault integrated certificate: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2995

Release: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=580913

- [x] DEV
- [ ] PROD

### Licenses service

Changes:
- Use KeyVault integrated certificate: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2995

Release: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=580910

- [x] DEV
- [ ] PROD

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Accessibility: Color-Contrast too low on package page" (#7847) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
I played around with [Accessibility Insights](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and tried it on NuGet.org. The site seems (at least from the "Fast pass") quite good regarding accessibility, but the color on the package page for the currently released package is too low.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. On this URL 'https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json/'
2. Perform this operation 'FastPass with https://accessibilityinsights.io/'
3. See error

### Expected behavior
"Congratulations!
No failed automated checks were found."

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/756703/74595115-19d7f800-503e-11ea-8730-fb319a456680.png)

### Additional context
The link color and the background color (this blue-ish color) are problematic. I'm not sure if this combination is used on other pages as well. I would guess that the best fix would be to change the background color of the "bg-info" class. 

I could try to find a color combination, but I guess there is not "right" or "wrong", but if you would like that I should try something just give me a comment here. :)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Epic] Improve search results for Visual Studio (VS) client" (#7657) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Removed some hot path logs" (#7846) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: This was logging *every* time a search service request was sent. This line alone produces 500k-1m log lines per hour and duplicates the `dependencies` logging that is populated automatically.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget.exe pack should no longer warn about packing a SemVer 2.0.0 package" (#5201) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Consider this nuspec:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<package xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2012/06/nuspec.xsd">
    <metadata>
        <id>jver.bugbash.dependency</id>
        <version>1.0.0-b1</version>
        <authors>jver</authors>
        <requireLicenseAcceptance>false</requireLicenseAcceptance>
        <description>My package description.</description>
        <dependencies>
            <dependency id="Newtonsoft.Json" version="1.0.0-alpha.1" />
        </dependencies>
    </metadata>
</package>
```

Command: `nuget.exe pack jver.bugbash.dependency.nuspec`
```
Attempting to build package from 'jver.bugbash.dependency.nuspec'.
Successfully created package 'C:\Users\jver\Desktop\packages\jver.bugbash.dependency.1.0.0\jver.bugbash.dependency.1.0.0-b1.nupkg'.
```


This is a SemVer 2.0.0 package because the dependency version range has a dot in it, i.e. `1.0.0-alpha.1`.

However `nuget.exe pack` does not warn about this SemVer 2.0.0-ness like it does when the package version itself has a dot.

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<package xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2012/06/nuspec.xsd">
    <metadata>
        <id>jver.bugbash.dependency</id>
        <version>1.0.0-b.1</version>
        <authors>jver</authors>
        <requireLicenseAcceptance>false</requireLicenseAcceptance>
        <description>My package description.</description>
    </metadata>
</package>
```

Command: `nuget.exe pack jver.bugbash.dependency.nuspec`
```
Attempting to build package from 'jver.bugbash.dependency.nuspec'.
Successfully created package 'C:\Users\jver\Desktop\packages\jver.bugbash.dependency.1.0.0\jver.bugbash.dependency.1.0.0-b.1.nupkg'.
WARNING: Issue found with package 'jver.bugbash.dependency'.

WARNING: Issue: Package version not supported on legacy clients.
WARNING: Description: The package version '1.0.0-b.1' uses SemVer 2.0.0 or components of SemVer 1.0.0 that are not supported on legacy clients. This message can be ignored if the package is not intended for older clients.
WARNING: Solution: Change the package version to a SemVer 1.0.0 string. If the version contains a release label it must start with a letter.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CommandRunnerResult works differently with dotnet.exe vs nuget.exe?" (#9190) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In dotnetsourcestests.cs needed to use item2, where item3 worked in nuget.exe based tests

```
                // TODO: Item2 in dotnet, vs Item3 in nuget.exe -- switched
                result.Item2.Contains(expectedErrorMessage),
                "Expected error is " + expectedErrorMessage + ". Actual error is " + result.Item2);
```

Figure out difference that causes that...in order to simplify porting any tests from nuget.exe to dotnet.exe

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Accessibility Fixes in PM UI" (#9157) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## batch 3
- [994456](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/994456) - PackageDetail - Tags - A11y_NuGetClient-MinorUIChanges_TestPackageDeprecationOther_ScreenReader : Narrator does not announces "Blank" for the blank field.
- [994459](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/994459) - PackageDetail - A11y_NuGetClient-MinorUIChanges_TestPackage.Deprecation.Other_Installed_ScreenReader : Narrator is annoucing "Dependencies" for "No Dependencies" text.

## batch 4
- [994452](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/994452) - PackageItem - A11y_NuGetClient-MinorUIChanges_Browse_ScreenReader : Screen reader focus is not going on the  "version and Package Description" text.

## batch 5
-[1049215](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1049215) - PackageDetail -nuget.org link- A11y_VS ASP.NET and Web Development_ Install Nuget Packages _ Screen Reader: Narrator is not reading the link text for “nuget.org” link
-[994495](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/994495) - PackageDetail - LicenseUI - A11y_NuGetClient-MinorUIChanges_TestPackage.Deprecation.CriticalBugs.AlternatePackage_Installed_ScreenReader : Narrator is not announcing the label association for the "MIT" link.

Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.

2.

...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!
